snippet: The Supreme Court decision to permit DNA collection from people who have been charged but not yet convicted severely undermines fundamental Fourth Amendment principles.
abstract: Editorial criticizes Supreme Court decision upholding Maryland law that allows police to collect suspect's DNA without warrant or probable cause; argues decision undermines fundamental Fourth Amendment principles that protect individuals against unjustified searches and incursions on privacy by law enforcement.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court decision to permit DNA collection from people who have been charged but not yet convicted severely undermines fundamental Fourth Amendment principles.

headline.seo: The Supreme Court Rules on DNA and Suspicionless Searches
